This SLA has been impacted by the backlog of ill health retirement cases still being worked through and this continues to impact performance in this area. 

This is not a Capita TP generated backlog, it is work that has been generated within the Ill Health casework under contract with another provider, however, impacts on Capita performance because of the link to TPS benefits. 

 A remedial plan is in place and it is anticipated that all outstanding cases will be completed by the end of May, which will see a positive impact on performance.

Contract title and description: Network Services Telephony
KPI name and description: Number of Incidents Resolved within Maximum Resolution Time (where 39 or less incidents raised in Service Period): - Severity 1 & 2 Maximum Resolution Time = 6 hours - Severity 3 Maximum Resolution Time = End of next Working Day
Good target: No more than two Incidents are Resolved in excess of the Maximum Resolution Time
Comments: March – Service Availability dropped to 96.30%, this falls in between “Inadequate Threshold” and “Requires Improvement Threshold”. Looking at the summary of incidents for March this was down to Early Life Support of the new platform (migration from Finesse to Cisco Webex) there were 8 incidents logged from P1 to P3, a number later dropped to P4 on investigation/progress. P1 Call cut offs, resolved with config change on the evening failed SLA. Other P2/P3 were handled in a timely organised manner via ongoing ELS calls.

Contract title and description:
CONTRACT FOR THE PROVISION OF 
CENTRAL COMMISIONING FACILITY (CCF)
KPI name and description:
Scheme Spend


(Actual spend for period plus any reconciliation/accruals adjustments)
Good target: Total programme and infrastructure outturn spend is within ± 1% of the annually agreed budget (taking into account DHSC requirements of reconciliation and accruals)
Comments: The final outturn was 4.2% below budget, due to reported ASTOX underspend in several areas being higher than originally forecasted. The cause of the slippage had been investigated and found to be largely due to COVID-19, inability to recruit participants and Reset. The risk of the impact of COVID-19 and the restarting of research had been discussed at Board meetings and it had been agreed that LGC would not be penalised for the budget variation where this was the cause.

Contract title and description: Strengthening the teaching of primary school mathematics in Malawi
KPI name and description:
KPI2
   Set of  submitted quarterly milestones are of good quality as gauged by the Education Adviser (Technical criterion, weight at 50%) and by the Ministry of Education Director of Quality Assurance (government embedding and sustainability criterion, weight at 50%)
   The milestones are of good quality- i.e., technically strong and well embedded into government systems, facilitating government take-up and sustainability”
   1. Technical criterion- The Education Adviser will gauge the quality of submitted milestones as a whole (the set of milestones as a proxy for progress in implementation, not one by one) based on national and international evidence and given analysis of constraints and opportunities; it will also consider Value for Money and innovation. The Adviser will write a short memo accompanying the score (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
    2. Government embedding and sustainability criterion: the Director of Quality Assurance, who is the government coordinator for the programme, will have a quarterly meeting with FCDO which will be minuted, and score whether the set of milestones are embedding the programme in government systems and are considering sustainability (good/approaching target/requires improvement/inadequate).  
   Good: both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target
   Approaching target: both scores are approaching target or one is approaching target and one requires improvement.
   Requires improvement: both scores require improvement or one is requiring improvement and one is inadequate  
   Inadequate: Both scores are inadequate
Good target: Both technical and government embedding scores are good or one is good and one is approaching target

KPI1

KPI name and description:

Contract title and description: PROJ10011 Independent evaluation contract for the Girls’ Education Challenge Fund Phase II (GEC II)
KPI name and description:
Quality of programme deliverables and activities, and alignment of project outputs to target stakeholders’ learning and evidence needs. Percentage of KPI is measured by taking in consideration supplier’s achievement in quarterly scoring system done by FCDO: 
   • 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   • 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.
   • 3 = 50% Most responsibilities are delivered efficiently and effectively. Some improvements should be made.
   • 2 = 33% Some criteria met but significant improvements needed.
   • 1 = 16% Serious under performance. Not meeting requirements. Immediate and major changes needed
   – KPI description is a summarised version of a more detailed indicator embedded in the contract
Comments: Final Report for Study 4 for FCDO approval, the draft Fieldwork Report for Study 5 for FCDO review and comment, and the project selection criteria for Study 6. The IE also presented findings from Study 3 in a webinar hosted by FCDO.

Contract title and description: RECRUITING PARTNERING CONTRACT-HQLF2/1739
KPI name and description: Recruitment of Regular Soldiers: Demand/Baseline Recruit Allocation Plan percentage
Comments: KPI1 reflects Capita’s performance in recruiting soldiers to meet specific monthly targets across a wide range of job roles. With regards KPI 1, CAPITAs ability to achieve recruitment targets during Q4 has been impacted by the ongoing buoyant National jobs market that shows a high vacancy rate, with job postings some 43% above pre-pandemic levels, which means that Capita with the Army offer is competing against many other potential employers to attract recruits to fill these vacancies, whilst at the same time there has been a reduction in the size of the eligible target audience due to changing social demographics. To address these challenges,  Capita is working closely with the Army to drive a number of initiatives seeking to increase overall volumes and further improve conversion rates; these include the recent launch of a new Army website to attract potential candidates, and optimisation of current marketing activities to maximise engagement with main target audiences and generally raise the profile of the Army as an attractive career choice.

Contract title and description: PROVISION OF AIRCRAFT, INSTRUCTORS & SERVICES TO SUPPORT UAS & EFT, YRS 5 & 6
KPI name and description: Number of Sorties not conducted due to aircraft availability
Comments: During early 2023 the Grob fleet suffered two "pauses" due to separate technical issues that were the result of Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) design activity. The oversight and management of both events mitigated any safety risk due to the collaborative and collegiate approach taken by MOD and Babcock Aerospace. The joint activity was effective in creating an open and effective pathway to resolution, utilising OEM and regulatory information and guidance. The KPI non achievement was not due to poor performance and therefore no remedial activity is required. All parties agreed that the shared approach to this unique situation maintained the highest level of open reporting/safety management and effective resolution.
